cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 495 miles east of the northwestern Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to slow, then turn west-southwest Tuesday–Wednesday, crossing the northwestern Bahamas Wednesday and moving toward Florida’s east-central coast Wednesday night, then sweeping inland across the peninsula and toward the northeast Gulf coast late Thursday–Friday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast between Hallandale Beach and the Volusia/Brevard County line

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hallandale Beach to north of Ocean Reef and Altamaha Sound, GA southward to the Volusia/Brevard County line
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire east coast of Florida from Hallandale Beach northward, northwestern Bahamas, and eventually southeast Georgia and South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible late Wednesday into Thursday; brief stronger gusts possible if Nicole attains hurricane strength near landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft of surge possible along Biscayne Bay and the Miami-Dade coast, especially at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain totaling 2–4 inches, locally higher, Wednesday–Thursday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents and minor coastal flooding could disrupt port operations.
